column2: The queen of ancient Egypt was Cleopatra.
During the Old Kingdom, Egypt was divided into two main countries, Upper Egypt and Lower Egypt.
In 2700 BC, the different regions of Egypt were united into one kingdom. This is the beginning of the second dynasty and the beginning of the heyday of ancient pharaonic Egypt.
The first pyramid is the step pyramid of Pharaoh Djoser in Saqqara, which was built in approximately 2700 BC.
During this period, Egypt maintained extensive trade relations with Sudan, Libya, the Land of Israel and Phenicia. The means of payment was a metal ingot of fixed weight.
